property.name: summary
property.value: A unique identifier assigned to all approved courses that exist in the catalog This is not updatable once initialized.

property.name: description
property.value: A unique identifier assigned to all approved courses that exist in the catalog This is not updatable once initialized.

property.name: summary
property.value: Identifies the number of a course as reflected in the course catalog.

property.name: description
property.value: Identifies the number of a course as reflected in the course catalog. This typically must be unique across all courses offered during that term. If the user wants to create two separate offerings for the same course they must modify this code to make it unique. For example: An on-line offering of the course might have an "O" appended to it to distinguish it from the face to face offering, i.e. ENG101 and ENG101O Initially copied from the course catalog but then, depending on the configuration it may be updatable. Often this field is configured so that it is not not directly updatable but rather is calculated from it's two constituent parts, the subject area and the course number suffix. For example: Subject Area = "ENG" and Suffix = "101" then code = "ENG101"

property.name: summary
property.value: A suffix of the course number as reflected in the college catalog.

property.name: description
property.value: A suffix of the course number as reflected in the college catalog. This is the "number" portion of the course code. Initially copied from the course catalog but then, depending on the configuration it may be updatable. This field is often configured to be updatable but the updates typically simply append something like an "O" for on-line to it to differentiate multiple course offerings for the same course. Often used in the calculation of the courseCode.

property.name: summary
property.value: Name of the course used in the college catalog.

property.name: description
property.value: Name of the course used in the college catalog. Initially copied from the course catalog but then, depending on the configuration it may be updatable. For regular courses this is not generally allowed to be updated on the offering, but for special topics courses this is often overridden to capture the particular topic being taught offered this term. Note: the configuration of the validation for titles is typically restricted to exclude line breaks. This may have to be loosened as some schools may want the particular topic to appear on a 2nd line. For example: SPECIAL TOPICS: AN EXPLORATION OF DEEP SPACE ARTIFACTS

property.name: summary
property.value: Indicates that the entire course offering is an Honors Course ???

property.name: description
property.value: Indicates that the entire course offering is an Honors Course ??? Is this an enrollment restriction rule or a flag or both?

property.name: summary
property.value: Instructors for this course offering TODO: find out if the canonical instructors should be copied down

property.name: description
property.value: Instructors for this course offering TODO: find out if the canonical instructors should be copied down

property.name: summary
property.value: Identifies the department and/subject code of the course as reflected in the course catalog.

property.name: description
property.value: Identifies the department and/subject code of the course as reflected in the course catalog. Initially copied from the course catalog but then, depending on the configuration it may be updatable. In most configurations this should not be updatable. Often used in the calculation of the courseCode

property.name: summary
property.value: Organization(s) that is responsible for administering the course delivery - and all associated logistics - of the course Initially copied from the canonical course then, depending on the configuration, updated This is typically an academic department but could be for example the extended studies office that is responsible for delivering the course even though it's content is managed by an academic department.

property.name: description
property.value: Organization(s) that is responsible for administering the course delivery - and all associated logistics - of the course Initially copied from the canonical course then, depending on the configuration, updated This is typically an academic department but could be for example the extended studies office that is responsible for delivering the course even though it's content is managed by an academic department.

property.name: summary
property.value: Organization(s) that is responsible for the academic content of the course as approved in its canonical form.

property.name: description
property.value: Organization(s) that is responsible for the academic content of the course as approved in its canonical form. This is the organization that has oversight of the curriculum. This is typically an academic department.

property.name: summary
property.value: Indicates whether a final exam is to be given Initially copied from the canonical course and then, depending on configuration, updated.

property.name: description
property.value: Indicates whether a final exam is to be given Initially copied from the canonical course and then, depending on configuration, updated.

property.name: summary
property.value: Total maximum number of "seats" or enrollment slots that can be filled for the offering.

property.name: description
property.value: Total maximum number of "seats" or enrollment slots that can be filled for the offering. Calculated based on sum of all the maximum seats of primary activity type offerings.

property.name: summary
property.value: Total minimum number of seats that must be filled for the offering not to be canceled.

property.name: description
property.value: Total minimum number of seats that must be filled for the offering not to be canceled. Calculated based on sum of all the minimum seats of primary activity type offerings

property.name: summary
property.value: The unique identifier of the other course offerings with which this offering is joint-listed

property.name: description
property.value: The unique identifier of the other course offerings with which this offering is joint-listed

property.name: summary
property.value: Type of credit of course offering.

property.name: description
property.value: Type of credit of course offering. This field is initially copied from the canonical course but then, depending on configuration, it may be updated. TODO: figure out which of the credit options will be copied down because the canonical has more than one! Often it is just a fixed single value but a ResultValuesGroup could contain a range (with increments) or even a discrete list of possible credit values.

property.name: objectDescription
property.value: Type of credit of course offering. This field is initially copied from the canonical course but then, depending on configuration, it may be updated. TODO: figure out which of the credit options will be copied down because the canonical has more than one! Often it is just a fixed single value but a ResultValuesGroup could contain a range (with increments) or even a discrete list of possible credit values.

property.name: summary
property.value: The scale to which this group belongs.

property.name: description
property.value: The scale to which this group belongs. Result Values mapped to a Result Values Group belong to a single Result Scale.

property.name: summary
property.value: Contains the list of discrete results value keys in this group.

property.name: description
property.value: Contains the list of discrete results value keys in this group.

property.name: summary
property.value: The range contained within this result value group.

property.name: description
property.value: The range contained within this result value group. This is optional and might not be present for some Result Components

property.name: objectDescription
property.value: The range contained within this result value group. This is optional and might not be present for some Result Components

property.name: summary
property.value: Min Result Value string Lower end of the value range.

property.name: description
property.value: Min Result Value string Lower end of the value range. Typically corresponds with the short coded form of the result(ex. "1.0", "25.0" etc.) Should the data resultTypeKey of values (min/max) be numbers and not Strings in the value range?

property.name: summary
property.value: Max Result Value string Upper end of the value range.

property.name: description
property.value: Max Result Value string Upper end of the value range. Typically corresponds with the short coded form of the result(ex. "3.0", "100.0" etc.). Upper end can be left empty to indicate unbounded upper end.

property.name: summary
property.value: Increment number Legal increments in the result values.

property.name: description
property.value: Increment number Legal increments in the result values. This has to be a decimal e.g 0.5)

property.name: summary
property.value: Create and last update info for the structure.

property.name: description
property.value:
Create and last update info for the structure. This is optional and treated as read only since the data is set by the internals of the service during maintenance operations.
Contains audit trail information about the creation and last update of this object Also contains the version ind used for optimistic locking.
Attempts to set or update should result in a ReadOnlyException being thrown.

property.name: objectDescription
property.value:
Create and last update info for the structure. This is optional and treated as read only since the data is set by the internals of the service during maintenance operations.
Contains audit trail information about the creation and last update of this object Also contains the version ind used for optimistic locking.
Attempts to set or update should result in a ReadOnlyException being thrown.

property.name: summary
property.value: The options/scales that indicate the allowable grades that can be awarded.

property.name: description
property.value: The options/scales that indicate the allowable grades that can be awarded. Typically the values here are constrained by the values on the canonical course. If the value is set here then the Clu must have a grading option set on the canonical activity. For example: an id might point to Pass/Fail or Letter Graded option.

property.name: summary
property.value: Key indicating the level at which grade rosters should be generated - activity, format or course.

property.name: description
property.value: Key indicating the level at which grade rosters should be generated - activity, format or course. TODO: define these types. TODO: add a service method to get the list of types that can be put in this field.

property.name: summary
property.value: Indicates whether a RegistrationGroup has a waitlist TODO: figure out how to store this TODO: make sure we are consistent on how we spell Waitlist, should be spelled Waitlist, or Wait List or Wait-List (as the merriam-webster has it)

property.name: description
property.value: Indicates whether a RegistrationGroup has a waitlist TODO: figure out how to store this TODO: make sure we are consistent on how we spell Waitlist, should be spelled Waitlist, or Wait List or Wait-List (as the merriam-webster has it)

property.name: summary
property.value: Indicates the type of waitlist as it relates to processing students on and off The three types predefined in kuali are Automatic, Semi-Automatic and Manual TODO: Right not Waitlist types are not tied to any Waitlist object so we need to define an "other key" to get the list of valid values from the type service.

property.name: description
property.value: Indicates the type of waitlist as it relates to processing students on and off The three types predefined in kuali are Automatic, Semi-Automatic and Manual TODO: Right not Waitlist types are not tied to any Waitlist object so we need to define an "other key" to get the list of valid values from the type service. TODO: Decide if we need a separate getHasWaitList, perhaps no value in this field means no waitlist. TODO: Cross validate with hasWaitlist

property.name: summary
property.value: Maximum number of students to be allowed on the wait list

property.name: description
property.value: Maximum number of students to be allowed on the wait list

property.name: summary
property.value: Indicates if the waitlist requires checkin

property.name: description
property.value: Indicates if the waitlist requires checkin

property.name: summary
property.value: The kind of units associated with the time quantity.

property.name: label
property.value: Academic Time Period Duration Type Key

property.name: description
property.value:
The kind of units associated with the time quantity.
For example months, days, week, semesters, years, minutes, seconds

property.name: description
property.value:
The amount of time.
The general design of this is that it should normally contain integer quantity and not hold fractions or decimals. Instead the Duration Type should changed to a shorter duration.
However this is a string to allow some implementing schools, if they wish, to capture this information in fractional units which may be more natural.

property.name: summary
property.value: The primary source of funding for the offering.

property.name: description
property.value: The primary source of funding for the offering.

property.name: summary
property.value: Fees associated with the course offering.

property.name: description
property.value: Fees associated with the course offering. Initially copied from the course catalog but then, depending on the configuration it may be updatable.
